title: How to Create Stairs in SketchUp

steps.title: Create the platform that you will need to build the stairs from.
steps.content: Create the platform that you will need to build the stairs from. Most likely, it will need to be perpendicular to a building.

steps.title: Create two 12" lines perpendicular to each other.
steps.content: Create two 12" lines perpendicular to each other. Attach them to the platform that you created.

steps.title: Copy them and attach them, repeatedly.
steps.content: Copy them and attach them, repeatedly. Do this until they reach the 'floor'.

steps.title: At the bottom of the stairs, draw a line going back towards the way they came from.
steps.content: At the bottom of the stairs, draw a line going back towards the way they came from. Use the inference point to stop it at the right location.

steps.title: From that point, draw a line to the origin of the stairs to complete the surface.
steps.content: From that point, draw a line to the origin of the stairs to complete the surface. Once you complete the 'loop', the surface will fill in.

steps.title: Click on the Push/Pull tool to widen the stairs.
steps.content: Click on the Push/Pull tool to widen the stairs. Use inference to match the width of the platform.
